citations.narrative:
On May 20, 2023, an employee of the licensee transported an adult, male camel in a livestock trailer to her Attending
Veterinarian for a routine examination. On the trip back to her facility, an unsecured trailer door opened and the camel
stepped out of the trailer onto the highway. It was loaded back into the trailer without damage to any vehicles or
passengers. The licensee contacted her Attending Veterinarian who went to the licensee’s facility the same day and
examined the camel, which was treated for minor abrasions and soft tissue injury to its left rear foot. Improper handling of
animals can result in trauma, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort to the animal and can be a
danger to the public. The licensee must ensure that handling of all animals, including during transport, is done as
expeditiously and carefully as possible to ensure the well-being of the animals and safety of the public.
To be corrected by June 06, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On May 20, 2023, an employee of the licensee transported an adult, male camel in a livestock trailer to her Attending 
Veterinarian for a routine examination. On the trip back to her facility, an unsecured trailer door opened and the camel 
stepped out of the trailer onto the highway. It was loaded back into the trailer without damage to any vehicles or 
passengers. The licensee contacted her Attending Veterinarian who went to the licensee’s facility the same day and 
examined the camel, which was treated for minor abrasions and soft tissue injury to its left rear foot. Improper handling of 
animals can result in trauma, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort to the animal and can be a 
danger to the public. The licensee must ensure that handling of all animals, including during transport, is done as 
expeditiously and carefully as possible to ensure the well-being of the animals and safety of the public. 
To be corrected by June 06, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
